Submodules¶

nba.dates module¶

nba.dates.date_list(d1, d2)¶

Takes two datetime objects or datestrings and returns a list of datetime objects

Parameters:
  • d1 – more recent datetime object or string
  • d2 – less recent datetime object or string
Returns:

dates – list of datetime objects
Return type:

list

Examples

for d in date_list(‘10_09_2015’, ‘10_04_2015’):
print datetime.strftime(d, ‘%m_%d_%Y’)
nba.dates.format_type(datestr)¶

Uses regular expressions to determine format of datestring

Parameters:d (str) – date string in a variety of different formats
Returns:fmt – format string for date
Return type:str
nba.dates.site_format(site)¶

Stores date formats used by different sites

nba.dates.strtodate(d)¶

Converts date formats used by different sites

nba.dfs module¶

nba.dfs.dk_points(player)¶

Calculates draftkings NBA points, including 2x and 3x bonus

Parameters:player (dict) – has pts, reb, etc.
Returns:dk_pts – number of draftkings points scored by the player
Return type:float
nba.dfs.fd_points(player)¶

Calculates fanduel NBA points

Parameters:player (dict) – has pts, reb, etc.
Returns:fd_pts – number of fanduel points
Return type:float

nba.games module¶

class nba.games.NBAGames¶

Provides lookup table for games. Can use “gamecode” format to figure out nbacom_game_id, visitor_team_id, home_team_id Can create from file or from database table

Usage:
g = NBAGames() games = g.games() gamecode = ‘20150101/CLECHI’ game_ids = g.game_ids(gamecode)
game_ids(gamecode)¶

Provides lookup dictionary for game information based on gamecode (‘20150101/CLECHI’)

Parameters:gamecode (str) – in YYYYMMDD/VISHOM format
Returns:game_ids – keys are nbacom_game_id, visitor_team_id, home_team_id
Return type:dict
games(file_name=None, table_name=None)¶

Dictionary of gamecode: {nbacom_game_id, visitor_team_id, home_team_id}

Parameters:
  • file_name (str) – file with games datastructure
  • table_name (str) – database table for games (typically ‘games’)
Returns:

games – keys are gamecode, values are dict with keys nbacom_game_id, visitor_team_id, home_team_id
Return type:

dict

nba.names module¶

names.py

nba.names.doug_name(name)¶

Returns string in doug format: last,first, lowercase, no punctuation, 16 character max

nba.names.espn_doug(self, espn_names, doug_names)¶
nba.names.first_last(name)¶

Returns name in First Last format

nba.names.last_first(name)¶

Returns name in Last, First format

nba.names.match_player(to_match, match_from, threshold=0.8)¶
Parameters:
  • to_match (str) – player name to match
  • match_from (list) – list of player names to match against
Returns:

name – matched name from match_from list
Return type:

str

Example

name = match_player(player, players)

nba.players module¶

class nba.players.NBAPlayers(db=False, polite=False)¶

Bases: object

TODO: need to update / merge this with the names module Provides for updating nba.com players table (stats.players) Also permits cross-reference of player names and player ids from various sites(stats.player_xref)

Usage:
np = NBAComPlayers(db=True) np.missing_players(‘2015-16’)
missing_players(season)¶

Looks for missing players by comparing current_season_gamelogs and players tables Fetches player_info by id, inserts player into players table

Parameters:season (str) – example ‘2015-16’ for the current season
Returns:missing – list of dictionaries that represent row in players table
Return type:list
nbacom_player(site, player_name)¶

Returns name and id of player on nba.com

Parameters:
  • site (str) – ‘dk’, ‘fd’, ‘rg’, ‘doug’, ‘espn’
  • player_name (str) – ‘Kevin Durant’, ‘Lebron James’
Returns:

player – first item is player name, second item is player id
Return type:

list
player_xref(site_name)¶

Obtains dictionary of site_player_id and nbacom_player_id

Parameters:site_name (str) – ‘dk’, ‘fantasylabs’, etc.
Returns:player_xref – key is site_player_id
Return type:dict
recent_nbacom_players()¶

Gets last couple of years of players from nba.com Returns dictionary with key of name + team

site_to_nbacom(site, player_name)¶

Returns dictionary with name of player on site, value is list of name and id of player on nba.com

Parameters:site (str) – ‘dk’, ‘fd’, ‘rg’, ‘doug’, ‘espn’
Returns:players – key is player name on site, value is list [nbacom_player_name, nbacom_player id]
Return type:dict

nba.positions module¶

class nba.positions.NBAPositions¶

Bases: object

fix_positions()¶

f = pd.read_csv(‘/home/sansbacon/FIXED_current_players.csv’) f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Center’, ‘primary_position’] = ‘C’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Center-Forward’, ‘position_group’] = ‘Big’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Center-Forward’, ‘primary_position’] = ‘C’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Forward-Center’, ‘position_group’] = ‘Big’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Forward-Center’, ‘primary_position’] = ‘PF’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Guard-Forward’, ‘position_group’] = ‘Wing’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Guard-Forward’, ‘primary_position’] = ‘SG’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Forward-Guard’, ‘position_group’] = ‘Wing’ f.ix[f.nbacom_position ==’Forward-Guard’, ‘primary_position’] = ‘SF’

nba.seasons module¶

class nba.seasons.NBASeasons¶

Bases: object

Finds NBA season start and end dates

Usage:
nbas = NBASeasons() current = nbas.season (‘2015-16’) # current is dict with start, end keys seas = nbas.in_what_season(‘2014-10-31’) # seas is dict with start, end keys end = nbas.season_end(‘2015-16’) # end is a datetime object representing last day of the season
in_what_season(day)¶
season(key)¶

Returns dictionary having keys start and end

season_dates(season, start_date=None, end_date=None)¶

Returns list of datetime objects for entire season or in custom date range

season_end(key)¶

Returns value for end key

season_start(key)¶

Returns value for start key

seasons(fn=None)¶

Returns OrderedDict of all seasons

nba.sim module¶

parallel-nbasim.py:
fantasy basketball season simulator
class nba.sim.NBASim¶

Bases: object

Usage:

import pandas as pd from NBASim import NBASim

sim = NBASim() urn = ‘http://www.dougstats.com/15-16RD.txt‘ frame = pd.read_fwf(urn) results = sim.sim(frame, iterations=10000) sim.to_csv(results, ‘sim.csv’)

sim(frame, iterations=500, num_players=10, num_teams=10)¶

nba.teams module¶

NBATeamNames.py Converts various team name formats to others Different sites use different names for the same NBA teams

class nba.teams.NBATeamNames¶

Converts NBA team name formats to others

Usage:

n = NBATeamNames()

n.long_to_short(‘Utah Jazz’)
‘UTA’
n.short_to_long(‘UTA’)
‘Utah Jazz’

long_to_short(name)¶
nbacom_code_to_short(code)¶
nbacom_short_to_code(name)¶
